There is a reason he doesn't use it a lot, it's just kind of a lazy reason. Goku is a Saiyan. He loves to fight. It's in his goddam DNA. If he used his Instant Transmission all over the fights would be boring. Remember, this is a guy who will let his enemies get stronger than him just so the fight can be interesting.

topics.body:
Lucky Star ep19 impressions

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[spoiler]seriously i feel like i've heard the OP more times than i actually have, curse you catchyness

daww virtual pet games

ooh an x-rated joke i didn't get, nobody explain it to me, i want to preserve my innocence

i thought Konata was talking about Gangnam Style and i was like WAIT HOW OLD IS THIS ANIME but then it was Gundam and i felt stupid

WHAT'S WITH THE CENSORING

i don't get the appeal of horror movies

[KNOWING NOTHING INTENSIFIES]

"why is it always so hot after a typhoon?" it's called humidity, it makes everything feel hotter than it's supposed to be

so many questions in this episode.

i never found baseball that interesting

that was the most intense tripping scene i have ever seen... but i have to ask why XD

YUTAKA. LET'S GO BOWLING.

short people problems, part 592346220

YUTAKA ON TITAN. sorry not sorry

"what does yaoi mean?" NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

i dont know whats going on with these EDs anymore

"I'M GONNA GET ME SOME"[/spoiler]

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fun fact, Eiichiro Oda actually worked as an assistant for Nobuhiro Watsuki of Rurouni Kenshin.
And Nobuhiro actually worked as an assistant for Takeshi Obata, the illustrator for Hikaru no Go, Death Note, and Bakuman.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/556a94da6368726d733f0700#post_556a94da6368726d733f0700
I understand why though; franchises that know they don't have a lot of steam left in them go the movie route to try to safe bet it.  The digimon franchise anime wise doesn't have a lot of steam left in it so making it into movies will squeeze out more money and is a safer bet financially.

It's essentially the phrase "risk it for a biscuit"; if people like it then digimon will come back in full force; if people don't like it then that at least gives them some money to justify continuing the franchise.

Pro:
If people like it then it's a second chance financially for the franchise.
